intro: Isolepis leptostachya, commonly known as slender spike rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in temperate regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense, spike-like clusters of small, greenish flowers. It thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, pond margins, and along streams. Isolepis leptostachya plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
